refnamediv.refpurpose: Prints at init-time using a printf() style syntax.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Prints at init-time using a printf() style syntax.

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: "string" -- the text string to be printed. Can be up to 8192 characters and must be in double quotes.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: xval1, xval2, ... (optional) -- The k-rate values or strings to be printed. These are specified in string with the standard C value specifier (%f, %d, %s etc.) in the order given.
prints is similar to the printks opcode except it operates at init-time instead of k-rate. For more information about output formatting, please look at printks's documentation.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para:
Here is an example of the prints opcode. It uses the file prints.csd.
Example of the prints opcode.
See the sections Real-time Audio and Command Line Flags for more information on using command line flags.
Its output should include a line like this:
1234.568 ;;;;;;semicolons!
